p.span:
Please note that this is will be a major release:
a lot of new features are included. Next week i will be in holiday... so if you will find any kind of bug please email me it... but don't worry if i will not reply you soon. A well know bug happen when you try to work on a device "busy" (in other word a device with a partition mounted). The only thing that i can suggest you is to commit every single operation, and reboot every time that you get the "commit error". This is not a bug of QTParted! It seems that the kernel is not able to re-read partition table of busy device. I plan to make some work around in the official 0.4, but of course i cannot do miracles until kernel developers will be fix this problem (and it seems that they don't want to do that :( ).
I forget: you need libparted 1.6.6 to run qtparted 0.4 !

Compiling sources: Before installing QtParted, you have to install a version of GNU Parted
Homepage: http://www.gnu.org/software/parted
QtParted-0.4.0 need parted-1.6.6: parted-1.6.6.tar.gz
You also have to install all other fstools (xfsprogs, jfsutils, ntfsprogs, progsreiserfs, ...) in order to have support for your favorite file system.
